citation.abstract: Grandmothers living with grandchildren face stressors that may increase depressive symptoms, but cognitive-behavioral strategies, such as resourcefulness, may reduce the effects of stressors on mental health.
citation.title: Longitudinal analysis of resourcefulness, family strain, and depressive symptoms in grandmother caregivers.

news.title: Study finds grandmothers who raise their grandkids struggle with depression
news.summary: Grandmothers who care for their grandkids fulltime need help for depression and family strains, report researchers from the Case Western Reserve University’s Frances Payne Bolton School of Nursing.

news.title: Grandmothers More Likely To Have Depression When They Raise Grandkids
news.summary: Brett Smith for redOrbit.com - Your Universe Online A new study from Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland found grandmothers who are a household’s primary caregiver are more likely to suffer from depression , but are highly receptive to assistance.

news.title: Grandmothers May Face Greater Risk For Depression If Caring For Grandchildren Full-Time
news.summary: Grandmothers who raise their grandchildren full-time could face a greater risk for depression due to the emotional and cognitive strain of child rearing.
